pr_title: Live reload: construct correct push URL when both service URL (and context path) and liveReloadPath are given

timeline.message: Live reload: construct correct push URL when both service url (and context path) and liveReloadPath are given
Move logic for determining push URL to ApplicationConnection

timeline.bodyText:
So the reload connection URL is just the same URL as the application URL?
Is it correct actually ?
Reload channel will use the application channel.
Won't they overlap ?
timeline.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText:
OR this is not a complete URL actually ?
Will it be used to append query parameters ?
Then from the comment above : looks like the name is confusing because it's not final URL....
replies.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText: If I'm not wrong a resource and query string are appended. In that sense it is not a complete URL.
replies.author: jm-ferreira

replies.bodyText: This part of the code only constructs the first part of the URL, which in the normal case is the application URL. The exception is when there is a context-relative push URL (in case of Spring) and then we use that instead. The remainder of the URL (query parameters) are the same in both cases.
replies.author: joheriks

replies.bodyText:
I would may be call it reloadConnectionBaseUri.
But may be it doesn't really matter.
replies.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText: Agree, that is a better name. Updated.
replies.author: joheriks
